HDB++ Tools documentationÂ¶

  • HDB++ is the TANGO History Database.
  • It can be used with Mysql or Cassandra database.
  • It is based on TANGO archive events.

Contents:

  • HDB++ Introduction
    • HDB++ Global principle
  • Tools Introduction
    • Goal
    • Start up
  • Configurator
    • Adding attribute
    • Adding several attributes
    • Adding a large number of attributes
      • By loading a file
      • By code
    • Start/Stop/Remove,....
    • Multiple TANGO_HOST
    • Archiver labels
      • Using Jive
      • Using the Configuartor tool
    • Defining contexts
    • Manage attribute strategy
      • By archiver
      • By strategy
  • Diagnostics
    • Main window
    • Faulty attributes
    • Attribute statistics
    • Change context
    • Distribution
  • Strategies and Contexts
    • Contexts
    • Strategies
  • TTL (Time To Live)

Warning

  • Since release 2.0 the GUI manage the storage strategy based on contexts.

    It is compatible only with a release of HdbConfigurationManager and HdbEventSubscriber managing features too.

  • Since release 3.0 the GUI manage the TTL (Time To Live) storage.

    It is compatible only with a release of HdbConfigurationManager and HdbEventSubscriber managing TTL too.

For classes information, see Programmer References
